story:
We're on a mission to bring stylish self-expression to your personal wardrobe.

Honestly, the secret is simple: Your clothes should make you look good, feel good, endure the whimsy of current trends and add to your mode of personal expression. 

I’m Nicole Allen, the lead designer for Historica Clothiers and for decades I’ve been telling stories about myself through fashion. Getting dressed each morning is the most obvious form of self-expression you will engage in all day. Clothes may not make the man but they certainly tell a wordless story. Your personal style can be an expression of your dreams, mood or fantasies (secret or otherwise). My hobbies relate to long held fantasies of my own: to dance, swordfight, wear armor, be a musician, paint, ride horses, and become a professional designer. But long before any of that became a reality, I created outfits that expressed the artist, fashion designer, dancer, rider and martial artist I didn't know I would become. Everywhere I've gone in the world, I’ve been told, 'I love what you are wearing, but I could never dress like that.’

Nonsense!

Historica Clothing exists to give you permission, options, inspiration and confidence to express yourself sartorially. We are creating fashion that's not just something to wear, but an experience that people want to share. For each piece in our line we’ve given you a storyline, a way to invite you into to another world, but the real point is for you to make it your own, and create your own story.

The concept of crowd-funded fashion is a thing whose time has come. We believe the key to designing clothing people feel they must wear, is to ask what they have dreamt of wearing. We’ve developed our first styles with a select group of folks just like you – people who saw a need for more colorful, expressive clothing in their lives. We call them our (cue the drumroll) Council of Consulting Clothiers.

You don’t need permission. Don’t dress like everyone else; step out of the mold and bring a new level of creativity and style to your personal image!

Who We Are and What This Campaign Will Allow Us to Do:

We’re launching the line with this campaign in order to fund the creation of initial line  - four styles each for men and women. We’ve chosen to start with tailored garments because they provide the most versatile, lasting, flattering styles – signature pieces that will become staples in your wardrobe and can be used both dressed up and dressed down. Making these patterns is a painstaking process, where we pick apart fit and drape of each style (as analyzed on real people in real sizes, not fantasy fit models). My team and I are credentialed, professional designers and personal clothiers that have been working in the online fashion business for over ten years. We know how to both create patterns that fit and flatter all body types, and how to present them online with tons of photos and fit details – you can trust these to be WYSIWIG designs, not the “bait and switch” we’ve all experienced shopping online.

All of our pieces are produced locally, here in Chicago, and everyone involved makes a fair wage. It’s important to us not just to make beautiful things but not to take advantage of anyone in the process of producing them. This also allows us to keep carefully track of the many details involved and assure you are getting the best possible garment.

Good ideas don’t work without a plan to make it real. We have the team, we have the expertise, we even have the corporate infrastructure already in place. But now…we need YOU! To bring these designs from the drawing to board to your closet we need to raise funds to launch the online marketplace, spend the time it takes to perfect the patterns, and oversea every detail of their production and distribution. We need you to join our Council of Consulting Clothiers!

Website: www.historicaclothiers.com

Email: csr@historicaclothiers.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/HistoricaClothiers

Twitter: www.twitter.com/historicacloth

What You Get:

Obviously, some cool new clothes! You will be the very first to see the Historica vision become reality, and you will look amazing doing it! PLUS as we reach each stretch goal we are also giving away some great perks! Your choice of some cool accessories to compliment your new outfit. We raise more and you get more! A lot more!

Why buy from us now?

We are creating limited edition versions of our initial eight styles – each one includes a signed and numbered label on our signature smuggler’s pocket, labeling you a member of our Council of Consulting Clothiers. Furthermore, everyone who orders one or more of the first styles will receive a personalized invitation to the Council: our private development group.

Love the idea, but aren’t ready to buy our clothes?

We are also offering entry-level perks to accommodate those who want to support us but for one reason or another aren’t ready to buy our clothes. 

Help Us Make This Happen!

The biggest way you can help us bring this into fruition? Spread the word! Have friends who love clothes and looking for more unique styles with real personality? Send them to us! Know someone who could use a little nudge in the style department? Send them to us! Know other people who would love to get in on the beginning of something cool and new? Send them to us! We’ll be waiting with open arms, and awesome clothes.

This campaign is only live for 31 days, so every day counts – so please share our campaign via Twitter, Facebook, email or other way that occurs to you! 

Now that you know who we are and what we are about, we want to introduce you to the family: our first eight fashions, each with a unique personality and a story to tell.

Dorian

He entered the parlor, a man of stunning -- some said haunting -- good looks. The very picture of the English gentleman, with the countenance of youth and smoldering, ancient eyes. At once, the partygoers set to whispering. "Is that, him?"

"They say he inherited Lord Wotton's fortune."

"They say he's indulged in a thousand passions."

"They say, he never ages..."

Lost in gossip, they did not realize the subject of their whispers was amongst them, until he bid them good evening. Embarrassed looks and nervous smiles, until Rothschild broke the awkward silence. "I say, old chap, it has been years and you haven't changed a whit!

The young man smiled coyly, and fingered his fine waistcoat, "You are too kind. I just have an excellent tailor."

Rothschild laughed, "Nonsense!  You look as fresh as the day you had that portrait painted by...what was that lad's name again?"

"Hallward. Basil Hallward."

"That's him! Odd, nervous fellow. Wasn't a bit surprised when he disappeared. I swear, Mr. Gray, that was the most uncanny bit of art I've ever seen! As if it were your living twin! Whatever came of it, anyway?"

Dorian Gray's smiled faded, and he looked thoughtful, "Oh, it's still around..."

Youth. Beauty. Admiration. We can't give you eternal youth, but beauty and admiration will abound when you don our men's classic waistcoat. A sleek, well-tailored garment that combines Victorian elegance and modern fashion-sense, this waistcoat will immediately make people stop and take notice!

Dorian Waistcoat

This fully-tailored piece is the perfect way to add a dash of panache and flattering lines to your everyday shirt and jeans. Dress it up with jacket and French cuffed shirt -- nothing says attention to detail like cufflinks. Our classic men’s waistcoat includes a few unique details including a notched back collar and triangle gusset in the bottom back which, along with the belt allows you to adjust for the perfect fit. Always thinking about the practical aspects of fashion, we’ve included 4 pockets – 3 welt pockets on the outside and our signature, interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a bus pass, or cell phone. If you have the spirit of the dandy in you the upper chest pocket is perfect for a pocket square, or use the lower pocket for that heirloom pocket watch.

Learn the lesson of Dorian Grey -- eternal youth is beyond our grasp; but truly fine clothes are timeless! Men's sizes S- XXL, but there nothing to say it wouldn't look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.

Shipping within the US $12, International Shipping $35

See Size Chart and Color Information

Cameron

Scotland, August 1745

When the Young Pretender rode onto the field the clansmen exchanged looks between them. He didn't look much like a king, with his thin limbs, his large soft eyes, and small chin. His uniform was prefect cut, but looked as if it had never seen a day in the field ere now. He wore the beautifully made broadsword at his hip awkwardly, as if unused to its weight. This was Charles Stuart, the man who claimed he would liberate the clans from the tyranny of England?

They watched intently as the Lochiel, chief of the clan, approached the Pretender on foot. Half again his breadth, and made the larger dressed in great kilt and bonnet, his sword and targe worn with a practiced ease, there could not have much less in common between the Stuart heir and Donald Cameron. For four hundred years, since the days of Robert the Bruce and his glorious victory over the hated Sassenach at the field of Bannockburn, Kings of Scotland had turned to Clan Cameron to be their strong swords in battle. Would the Lochiel draw his sword for the pale boy prince who came now before him?

The prince's horse paces nervously, as the pale boy exchanged words with the ruddy clan-chief, their words lost in the whipping, coastal wind. The men waited anxiously. At last, the Lochiel nodded and took two steps back from the boy-prince on his tall, pale horse. Turning toward the clansmen, Donald Cameron - the Cameron of Clan Cameron - drew his sword and held it aloft; its bright blade flickering in the grey light of a Scottish morning.

"Men of Cameron, loyal Jacobites, this is Charles, Grandson of James Stuart, Sixth of that name and rightful king of Scotland. As we fought the Longshanks, Cromwell and the men of Argyll before, I call ye now to war...."  He said more, he must have said more, but none could hear over the wind, and the cheers from a thousand throats as swords were drawn and musket butts beat on the ground. "For Charlie, King of Scotland! For the Lochiel! For Cameron! For glory!"

The Cameron Long Weskit

The final Jacobite uprising, led by Bonnie Prince Charlie and shattered by Redcoat guns on the fields of Culloden, is one of those "what if" moments of history that has inspired poets, artists and authors for generations. We honor the romantic, passionate image of the brave Gael with this 18th-century inspired weskit.  From the standing back collar and turned back lapels to the back button detail (which also has the advantage of giving you an adjustable fit). The Cameron works well as a stand alone piece or layered under a dress coat. The longer length, top stitched, six button front and flap pockets gives it a slightly more ‘dressed-up’ feel than your standard vest but is also great with jeans a favorite pair of boots. On the practical side of things we’ve also included four pockets, three exterior and our signature, interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a ID, or cell phone. May we suggest a carnation or silk pocket square for the upper breast pocket?

At home with trousers or your finest kilt - both traditional and modern. Men’s sizes S – XXL, but there nothing to say it wouldn't look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.

Shipping within the US $15, International Shipping $45

See Size Chart and Color Information

Horatio

"You sailed with Nelson?" It was the kind of question that was asked with awe, from the lowliest shipman to a captain of the line. "What was he really like?"

"What can I say lads? Nelson was all you imagined and more. Tall and regal, fearless and bold. Exacting and hard, but fair and with a concern for the boys, in his way." It was always the same: by this point the nosiest mess was silent and  I had the complete attention of all present. "I met him first after Toloun, just before we took Corsica from Bonaparte, and was with ever after - Cadiz, the Nile....right on to that hard day at Trafalgar."

And then, always the same questions, "Is it true the sniper 'it 'im cause 'e wouldn't take off 'is colors?"

"Oh tis true, lads, tis true. His officers bade him take off his admiral's stars that none might know who he was. But he stood there, with that broad tricorn on, his boots bright polished, and wearing that long, frockcoat, the right sleeve pinned up where hi s arm had been. And you know what he said? He said, Nay gentlemen. In honour I gained them, and in honour I will die with them."

There was a round of collective sighs. "Aye, and so he did lads, and so he did. But not before he gave the Frenchie a beating they'd never forget. So raise your cups to Admiral Horatio Nelson, a Norfolk man and hero such as will never be forgotten!"

We have chosen to name our reimagining of the long dress coat after one of the most romantic and gallant figures of the 18th century, Horatio Nelson, England's greatest naval hero, who tragically lost his life even as he was winning his greatest victory off the coasts of Trafalgar.

Horatio Long Dress Coat

The last years of the Enlightenment were a time of new ideas, bold actions and larger-than-life figures. The "noble experiment" of the American Revolution, the blood-soaked Terror of the French Revolution, and the long and valiant battles to prevent the Emperor Napoleon from conquering all of Europe. Bold eras often have bold fashions, and none more so than the gentleman's long dress coat, which grew out of military fashion. From the stand-up collar with pointed back seaming and turned back lapels to the twin back pleats, diagonal once piece cuff detail and longer length you will not find another more uniquely flattering coat. And its useful too – with three exterior and two interior pockets (including one than buttons closed to secure you valuables and our signature, interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a money clip or cell phone).

A dashing and elegant choice for the discerning gentleman equally at home worn with fedora and tie, waistcoat and dress pants or jeans a comfortable weekend shirt. Men’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.

Shipping within the US $18, International Shipping $55

See Size Chart and Color Information

Macheath

A rainy day in Old London; that fog-shrouded time when night and dawn walk hand-in-hand. A tall hat appears in the mist, accompanied by the crisp click of a brass-capped walking stick striking against the cobbles. You squint through wet lashes to see the face of that fine figure in the long, greatcoat. It's no avail, but as he draws closer you hear a rich baritone sing….(to the tune of Mack the Knife)

♪♪ Oh, the shark, babe, has such teeth, dear
And it shows them pearly white,
Just a jackknife has old Macheath, dear
And he keeps it, out of sight... ♪♪

Your heart quickens in your throat. Macheath? The gentleman thief of London? The cane clicks, the voice grows louder, he's nearly upon you and there's no time to run. Lord or highwayman, gentleman or rogue, one thing is for certain -- that is a mighty fine coat he wears.

Named for the dashing, swashbuckling highwayman of The Three Penny Opera, our greatcoat evokes an era when gentlemen set off for business and pleasure looking their best. Armed with a top hat, gloves and a well-knotted, silk scarf, a proper top coat did more than protect their finery from the rain - it was finery itself.

Macheath Greatcoat

As it was then, so it can be now!  The Macheath Greatcoat combines all of the classic elements of Victorian, manly elegance with touches of modern flare. Made with plenty of pockets to stow your conveniences in (two large outside pockets in the side seams and three interior pocket, including our signature  ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a jackkni…er…business cards or cell phone and two large pockets that button closed). Our Greatcoat has a full caplet to help ward off the worst of the weather that is sewn in to the front seams to keep it from flapping back in your face. The front button tab detail covers a hidden zipper for easy on/off and has the added advantage of buttoning the collar snugly around your neck. We included generous turned back cuffs, for that extra bit of flare and two sets of pleats in the back that provide fullness that flares dramatically with the breeze.

A stylish and practical choice for the discerning roustabout in you. Men’s sizes S – XXL, but there nothing to say it wouldn't look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.

Shipping within the US $23, International Shipping $55

See Size Chart and Color Information


Rebecca

Last night I dreamt I went to Manderley again...

I came upon it suddenly; the approach masked by the unnatural growth of a vast shrub that spread in all directions...

There was Manderley, our Manderley, secretive and silent as it had always been, the gray stone shining in the moonlight of my dream, the mullioned windows reflecting the green lawns and terrace. Time could not wreck the perfect symmetry of those walls, nor the site itself, a jewel in the hollow of a hand.

Since 1938, the opening lines of Daphne DuMaurier's Rebecca has taken readers by the hand into one of the great, gothic romances of all time. But for incurable romantics, Rebecca shall forever be the beautiful Joan Fontaine in Hitchock's 1940 masterpiece. What better name then for a waistcoat that brings back the dramatic elegance of 1940's fashion?

Rebecca Waistcoat

As the ultimate layering piece, our Rebecca can sass-up any style: from office wear to a night on the town. You will; find it equally at place with blouse and dress pants, over your favorite snug ‘kitten’ dress, or with a favorite hat, jeans and boots for a weekend adventuring outfit. The low cut shawl collar and ‘nipped in,’ double-breasted waist closure do nothing but flatter your curves. The fully tailored lines include princess seams front and back for smooth fit all finished off by a belt in back for final fit adjustments. We’ve heard the outcry ‘women need pockets, too!’ and so we’ve included 3 pockets – 2 welt pocket on the outside a nice place for dainty pocket watch) and our signature interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a credit card or cell phone.

Our Rebecca may not unite you with your heart’s desire, but you will never be mistaken for someone else. Women’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA. 

Shipping within the US $12, International Shipping $35

See Size Chart and Color Information

Jillian

What can you say about Jillian? Our friends at the Urban Dictionary knew best:

Jillian is an incredible friend, who's loyal and won't stab you in the back. She has an amazing sense of humor and loves to laugh and have a good time. She may come up with some ideas that simple minded humans cannot see the point or concept, these ideas takes someone else who's name shares the same magnitude as hers. Hot/sexy would also be another good term to address her appearance. Her intelligence is far beyond anything a simple mind can understand so don't even try to venture down that road. Simply put Jillian is awesome for lack of a better word.

Loyal...sexy....intelligent...awesome. Yes, that is exactly how you'll feel when you slip our Jillian on. And just like the Urban Dictionary, we promise that she won't let you down!

Jillian Laced Tunic/ Waistcoat

Designed to flatter your most feminine curves and a touch of the east in her front closure frogs – she performs the miracle of a tailored look and a ‘custom’ fit that is instantly alterable with her back lacing. Jillian is a lady with as many personalities as places in your wardrobe - as a sleeveless jacket for a more polished look, a vest layered over a flouncy dress for that added touch of flare or a tunic to wear with jeans and your favorite weekend boots.  She’s practical, too because as always we’ve included our signature interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for your cell phone or to save that napkin with the impromptu number on it.

Our Jillian will serve you well in all your endeavors – especially the ones that make you want to stand out a crowd. Women’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA. 


Shipping within the US $15, International Shipping $45

See Size Chart and Color Information

Marguerite

Paris, 1792 - The Terror sweeps the city with its bloody broom.

As those high and low who challenge the new regime are marched to the guillotine, only the mysterious Scarlet Pimpernel stands against the madness. His allies come from all walks of life, but none more alluring than Marguerite St. Just, a beautiful French actress, who, entranced by the Pimpernel's exploits, forces herself into his circle.

Marguerite's misfortune was to be the wife of the wealthy English fop Sir Percy Blakeney, a baronet whose only real accomplishment is his ability to be forever impressed with his own wit. Contemptuous of her cowardly and unloving husband, she's acted in the Pimpernel's interests alone, only to find herself blackmailed: reveal the identity of the Pimpernel or see her brother die.  With nowhere else to turn, she confides in the useless Sir Percy and learns a stunning truth -- he is the Scarlet Pimpernel!

How will Sir Percy and Marguerite escape the villainous Chauvelin's clutches? How can a bit of pepper in a gift snuff box prove an evil man's undoing? You will feel ready to live that adventure yourself when you slip into Marguerite, a frockcoat that brings the elegance of 1800 Paris into the Twenty-first Century world.

Marguerite Frockcoat

From her unique pointed lapel, to her lavishly full cascading skirts, Marguerite is a show stopper. A touch of a men’s frockcoat at the back waist with her twin buttons and princess seam pleats which someone how makes you look at that more feminine (what is about women in men’s styles that is so flattering?). Her crisp, tailored shoulders that widen into flared cuffs that are slit to show off the cuff of your blouse. Ever the pragmatic figure she also has three pockets, two generous side pockets in the skirts and our interior signature ‘smugglers’ pocket just the right size for a delicate, laced edged hanky or cell phone.

Murder. Blackmail. Intrigue. A ravishing beauty. All of this and true love saved by pepper? Our lady's frockcoat will bring you all the dramatic flare, without the risk of losing your head! (We can't say the same for that someone special who sees you wrapped in our Marguerite's embrace!) Women’s sizes S – XXL. (Consider how you might want to layer this piece when you choosing a size – she looks rather stunning when layered with a waistcoat like our Rebecca.) Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA. 

Shipping within the US $18, International Shipping $45

See Size Chart and Color Information

Brontë

'twere mad foolishness to have come here, he scolded himself. It could never be. His governess? A woman whose family had squandered all station, whose girls had lost all prospects? That was not why he had had them fetch her to Thornfield Hall! Well, if she came, he would tell her, "I am sorry, my dear Jane, but a madness overcame me." Yes, that was for the best...

But those words were never to reach his lips for the thought died the moment he spied her. A shy, but proud woman, she walked with nervous determination, the long skirts of her coat swaying from side to sided as she picked her way doggedly across the green. He could see her stop to scan the countryside -- seeking, seeking him.

Even from there, their eyes met and he was lost. His feet had a mind of his own as he tore across the heather, "oh my darling, darling girl...."

Charlotte. Emily. Anne. The Brontë sisters were not romance writers; they wrote the novels that defined for generations what high romance was all about! Elegance and passion, but always with proper manners and just the right touch of reserve; that's what defined these amazing women and their writing, and we've tried to give them a namesake that matches.  Bright, determined women overcoming incredible odds to find happiness with their one, true love – a coat just like this. The Brontë coatdress is one of most contemporary, yet evocative garments that, just like one Charlotte's heroines, can face all manner of challenges.

Brontë Coatdress

Is it is a coat, is it a dress? The answer is yes. With all the fit detail of the best tailored garments and the flattering lines from gowns of years past – this style is flexible and useful in the best sense – layered with a blouse and waistcoat, over your favorite cocktail dress or worn alone, buttoned up. We’ve included lots of delightful details – generous front pockets (set flatteringly on the diagonal) as well as a dainty watch pocket, handy for loose change or perfect for accessorizing with a pocket watch. The Bronte’s full sleeves have the added function of making you waist look that much smaller as do the flared skirts. The fully lined interior includes a large stoables pocket as well as our signature ‘smugglers’ pocket just the right size for cell phone or business cards. Finished with topstitching on collar and turned back cuffs for crispness and a nice kick-slit in the back for ease of walking.  If your one true love’s heart doesn’t skip a beat when they see you in this….well, it will.

Women’s sizes S – XXL, consider how you might want to layer this piece when you choosing a size. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.

Shipping within the US $23, International Shipping $55

See Size Chart and Color Information

FAQ:

I'm having trouble with Paypal or am not sure that my payment went through. What can I do to complete my contribution?

We are sorry to hear about the difficulty!  If you're having any trouble at all contributing via Paypal, or if you want to confirm that your payment went through, please contact us at csr@historicaclothiers.com and we'll do everything we can to help and make it as simple as possible for you!

What colors will these be available in? To begin with, we are offer these pieces in either black or burgundy wool. Depending on demand we may be able to offer additional color choices.

What sizes will these be available in? We are making both Men’s and Ladies styles in sizes S – XXL. See size chart for details:

Women's sizes

XS:  chest 34", waist 26 1/2", hip 36 1/2"

S: chest 36", waist 28 1/2", hip 38 1/2"

M: chest 38 1/2", waist 31", hip 41"

L:  chest 41 1/2", waist 34", hip 44"

XL:  chest 45 1/2", waist 38", hip 48"

XXL: chest 49 1/2", waist 43", hip 52"

Men's sizes

S: neck 14 1/2", chest 36", waist 30", sleeve 34"

M: neck 15 1/2", chest 40", waist 34", sleeve 34 1/2"  

L:  neck 16 1/2", chest 44", waist 38", sleeve 34 1/2"

XL: neck 17 1/2", chest 48", waist 42", sleeve 36 1/2"

XXL: neck 18 1/2", chest 52", waist 46", sleeve 37 ½"

How do I pick my size, color, stretch goal perk, etc?

No worries! Here is how Indiegogo works: we receive your contact information when you contribute, and after the campaign, we'll reach out to have you confirm all the details of your order.  

Can I change my order?

We are making each of these limited edition garments just for you. As our introductory line these are virtually one-of-kinds made for you - we won't know until the campaign ends which styles will become part of our permanent line. What we are offering here won't necessarily be representative of what will be our regular stock on our website so we won’t have extra stock to be able to switch your choice or accept exchanges. So choose carefully.

Can I order custom sizes or colors?

In a word, no. In order to be able to offer you great, original clothes at these prices we need to use economies of scale in production which means there needs to be some uniformity and limits to colors and sizes. But these are well made, tailored garments with real seam allowance so if you need a few tweaks like the waist taken in, a hem lengthened, etc – they are made to be alterable just like men’s suits and can be custom fit you by your local alterations shop – which is only way to get that ‘made for you’ fit.

When will I receive what I bought?

The second the campaign ends, January 31st, we start collating the results and finding out exactly what you’d like us to make. We then go into production the second week in February with the aim to ship them out to you by the end of March.

Can you explain about the cost of the garments?

We're facing several challenges which contribute to the bottom line of our styles: we produce locally, just outside of Chicago, USA (which is necessary to properly oversee all the details of production and make sure it gets made well but is costly), we're not producing in huge numbers like the big brands out there (which means higher cost per garment); and everyone involved in our process makes a living wage, is treated well and works in good working conditions (we are committed to working with partners that treat their workers fairly).

In the end, the Historica Clothiers that has all the features that the major labels do (actually allot more detail than most mass produced clothing), and, despite the challenges our products are competitively priced with equivalent pieces – that is the few out there that are actually producing well-made, well-cut, full featured clothing. That is, made of 100% wool with details like real pockets, full lining, under-stitched hems and sleeve caps – all things that add to the look, functionality and life of each garment.

Why is International Shipping so expensive?

The simple answer is these are our shipping costs – we aren’t making any money on in it. The last few years shipping costs have risen dramatically. We’re sorry. We love having customers all over the world.

Credits and Thanks:


This couldn't have happened without the help, inspiration and hard work of Kathy Henry, Rebecca Smith-Cruz, Jonathan Cruz, Heather Hilchey, Treyson Ptak, Greg Mele and Jill Allen who acted in turns as techo-whizs, models, writers, consultants and all-around cheerleaders.
story_txt:
We're
on a mission to bring stylish self-expression to your personal wardrobe.
Honestly,
the secret is simple: Your clothes should make you look good, feel good, endure
the whimsy of current trends and add to your mode of personal expression. 
I’m Nicole
Allen, the lead designer for Historica Clothiers and for decades I’ve been
telling stories about myself through fashion. Getting dressed each morning is the
most obvious form of self-expression you will engage in all day. Clothes may
not make the man but they certainly tell a wordless story. Your personal style
can be an expression of your dreams, mood or fantasies (secret or otherwise). My
hobbies relate to long held fantasies of my own: to dance, swordfight, wear
armor, be a musician, paint, ride horses, and become a professional designer.
But long before any of that became a reality, I created outfits that expressed
the artist, fashion designer, dancer, rider and martial artist I didn't know I
would become. Everywhere I've gone in the world, I’ve been told, 'I love
what you are wearing, but I could never dress like that.’ 
Nonsense!

Historica
Clothing exists to give you permission, options, inspiration and confidence to
express yourself sartorially. We are creating fashion that's not just something
to wear, but an experience that people want to share. For each piece in our
line we’ve given you a storyline, a way to invite you into to another world,
but the real point is for you to make it your own, and create your own story. 
The concept
of crowd-funded fashion is a thing whose time has come. We believe the key to
designing clothing people feel they must
wear, is to ask what they have dreamt
of wearing. We’ve developed our first styles with a select group of folks just
like you – people who saw a need for more colorful, expressive clothing in
their lives. We call them our (cue the drumroll) Council of Consulting
Clothiers. 
You don’t
need permission. Don’t dress like everyone else; step out of the mold and bring
a new level of creativity and style to your personal image!


Who We Are and What This Campaign Will Allow Us to Do:

We’re
launching the line with this campaign in order to fund the creation of initial
line  - four styles each for men and
women. We’ve chosen to start with tailored garments because they provide the
most versatile, lasting, flattering styles – signature pieces that will become
staples in your wardrobe and can be used both dressed up and dressed down.
Making these patterns is a painstaking process, where we pick apart fit and
drape of each style (as analyzed on real people in real sizes, not fantasy fit
models). My team and I are credentialed, professional designers and personal
clothiers that have been working in the online fashion business for over ten
years. We know how to both create patterns that fit and flatter all body types,
and how to present them online with tons of photos and fit details – you can
trust these to be WYSIWIG designs, not the “bait and switch” we’ve all
experienced shopping online. 
All of our
pieces are produced locally, here in Chicago, and everyone involved makes a
fair wage. It’s important to us not just to make beautiful things but not to
take advantage of anyone in the process of producing them. This also allows us
to keep carefully track of the many details involved and assure you are getting
the best possible garment.
Good ideas don’t work without a plan to make
it real. We have the team, we have the expertise, we even have the corporate
infrastructure already in place. But now…we need YOU! To bring these designs
from the drawing to board to your closet we need to raise funds to launch the
online marketplace, spend the time it takes to perfect the patterns, and
oversea every detail of their production and distribution. We need you to join our
Council of Consulting Clothiers!
Website: www.historicaclothiers.comEmail: csr@historicaclothiers.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/HistoricaClothiers
Twitter: www.twitter.com/historicacloth


What You Get:

Obviously, some cool new clothes! You will be the very
first to see the Historica vision become reality, and you will look amazing
doing it! PLUS as we reach each stretch goal we are also giving away some great perks! Your choice of some cool accessories to compliment your new outfit. We raise more and you get more! A lot more!
Why buy from us now? 
We are creating limited edition versions of our
initial eight styles – each one includes a signed and numbered label on our
signature smuggler’s pocket, labeling you a member of our Council of Consulting
Clothiers. Furthermore, everyone who orders one or more of the first styles will
receive a personalized invitation to the Council: our private development group.

Love the idea, but aren’t ready to buy our clothes? 
We are also offering entry-level perks to
accommodate those who want to support us but for one reason or another aren’t
ready to buy our clothes. 
 
Help Us Make This Happen!

The biggest way you can help us bring this into
fruition? Spread the word! Have friends who love clothes and looking for more
unique styles with real personality? Send them to us! Know someone who could
use a little nudge in the style department? Send them to us! Know other people who
would love to get in on the beginning of something cool and new? Send them to
us! We’ll be waiting with open arms, and awesome clothes.

This campaign is only live for 31 days, so every day
counts – so please share our campaign via Twitter, Facebook, email or other way
that occurs to you! 
Now that you know who we are and what we are about, we want to introduce you to the family: our first eight fashions, each with a unique personality and a story to tell.DorianHe entered the parlor, a man of stunning -- some said haunting -- good looks. The very picture of the English gentleman, with the countenance of youth and smoldering, ancient eyes. At once, the partygoers set to whispering. "Is that, him?""They say he inherited Lord Wotton's fortune.""They say he's indulged in a thousand passions.""They say, he never ages..."Lost in gossip, they did not realize the subject of their whispers was amongst them, until he bid them good evening. Embarrassed looks and nervous smiles, until Rothschild broke the awkward silence. "I say, old chap, it has been years and you haven't changed a whit!The young man smiled coyly, and fingered his fine waistcoat, "You are too kind. I just have an excellent tailor."Rothschild laughed, "Nonsense!  You look as fresh as the day you had that portrait painted by...what was that lad's name again?""Hallward. Basil Hallward.""That's him! Odd, nervous fellow. Wasn't a bit surprised when he disappeared. I swear, Mr. Gray, that was the most uncanny bit of art I've ever seen! As if it were your living twin! Whatever came of it, anyway?"Dorian Gray's smiled faded, and he looked thoughtful, "Oh, it's still around..."Youth. Beauty. Admiration. We can't give you eternal youth, but beauty and admiration will abound when you don our men's classic waistcoat. A sleek, well-tailored garment that combines Victorian elegance and modern fashion-sense, this waistcoat will immediately make people stop and take notice!Dorian WaistcoatThis fully-tailored piece is the perfect way to add a dash of panache and flattering lines to your everyday shirt and jeans. Dress it up with jacket and French cuffed shirt -- nothing says attention to detail like cufflinks. Our classic men’s waistcoat includes a few unique details including a notched back collar and triangle gusset in the bottom back which, along with the belt allows you to adjust for the perfect fit. Always thinking about the practical aspects of fashion, we’ve included 4 pockets – 3 welt pockets on the outside and our signature, interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a bus pass, or cell phone. If you have the spirit of the dandy in you the upper chest pocket is perfect for a pocket square, or use the lower pocket for that heirloom pocket watch.Learn the lesson of Dorian Grey -- eternal youth is beyond our grasp; but truly fine clothes are timeless! Men's sizes S- XXL, but there nothing to say it wouldn't look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.Shipping within the US $12, International Shipping $35See Size Chart and Color Information
Cameron

Scotland, August 1745
When the Young Pretender rode onto the
field the clansmen exchanged looks between them. He didn't look much like a
king, with his thin limbs, his large soft eyes, and small chin. His uniform was
prefect cut, but looked as if it had never seen a day in the field ere now. He
wore the beautifully made broadsword at his hip awkwardly, as if unused to its
weight. This was Charles Stuart, the man who claimed he would liberate the
clans from the tyranny of England? 
They watched intently as the Lochiel,
chief of the clan, approached the Pretender on foot. Half again his breadth,
and made the larger dressed in great kilt and bonnet, his sword and targe worn
with a practiced ease, there could not have much less in common between the
Stuart heir and Donald Cameron. For four hundred years, since the days of
Robert the Bruce and his glorious victory over the hated Sassenach at the field
of Bannockburn, Kings of Scotland had turned to Clan Cameron to be their strong
swords in battle. Would the Lochiel draw his sword for the pale boy prince who
came now before him? 
The prince's horse paces nervously, as
the pale boy exchanged words with the ruddy clan-chief, their words lost in the
whipping, coastal wind. The men waited anxiously. At last, the Lochiel nodded
and took two steps back from the boy-prince on his tall, pale horse. Turning
toward the clansmen, Donald Cameron - the Cameron of Clan Cameron - drew his
sword and held it aloft; its bright blade flickering in the grey light of a
Scottish morning.
"Men of Cameron, loyal Jacobites,
this is Charles, Grandson of James Stuart, Sixth of that name and rightful king
of Scotland. As we fought the Longshanks, Cromwell and the men of Argyll
before, I call ye now to war...." 
He said more, he must have said more, but none could hear over the wind,
and the cheers from a thousand throats as swords were drawn and musket butts
beat on the ground. "For Charlie, King of Scotland! For the Lochiel! For
Cameron! For glory!"
The
Cameron Long Weskit
The final Jacobite uprising, led by
Bonnie Prince Charlie and shattered by Redcoat guns on the fields of Culloden,
is one of those "what if" moments of history that has inspired poets,
artists and authors for generations. We honor the romantic, passionate image of
the brave Gael with this 18th-century inspired weskit.  From the standing back collar and turned back
lapels to the back button detail (which also has the advantage of giving you an
adjustable fit). The Cameron works well as a stand alone piece or layered under a
dress coat. The longer length, top stitched, six button front and flap pockets
gives it a slightly more ‘dressed-up’ feel than your standard vest but is also
great with jeans a favorite pair of boots. On the practical side of things
we’ve also included four pockets, three exterior and our signature, interior
‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a ID, or cell phone. May we
suggest a carnation or silk pocket square for the upper breast pocket? 
At home with trousers or your finest
kilt - both traditional and modern. Men’s sizes S – XXL, but there nothing to
say it wouldn't look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in
Chi-Town, USA.Shipping within the US $15, International Shipping $45See Size Chart and Color Information
Horatio

"You sailed with Nelson?" It
was the kind of question that was asked with awe, from the lowliest shipman to
a captain of the line. "What was he really like?"
"What can I say lads? Nelson was
all you imagined and more. Tall and regal, fearless and bold. Exacting and
hard, but fair and with a concern for the boys, in his way." It was always
the same: by this point the nosiest mess was silent and  I had the complete attention of all present.
"I met him first after Toloun, just before we took Corsica from Bonaparte,
and was with ever after - Cadiz, the Nile....right on to that hard day at
Trafalgar."
And then, always the same questions,
"Is it true the sniper 'it 'im cause 'e wouldn't take off 'is
colors?"
"Oh tis
true, lads, tis true. His officers bade him take off his admiral's stars that
none might know who he was. But he stood there, with that broad tricorn on, his
boots bright polished, and wearing that long, frockcoat, the right sleeve
pinned up where hi s arm had been. And you know what he said? He said, Nay gentlemen. In
honour I gained them, and in honour I will die with them." 
There was a round of collective sighs. "Aye,
and so he did lads, and so he did. But not before he gave the Frenchie a
beating they'd never forget. So raise your cups to Admiral Horatio Nelson, a
Norfolk man and hero such as will never be forgotten!"
We have chosen to
name our reimagining of the long dress coat after one of the most romantic and
gallant figures of the 18th century, Horatio Nelson, England's greatest naval
hero, who tragically lost his life even as he was winning his greatest victory
off the coasts of Trafalgar.
Horatio Long Dress Coat
The last years of the
Enlightenment were a time of new ideas, bold actions and larger-than-life
figures. The "noble experiment" of the American Revolution, the
blood-soaked Terror of the French Revolution, and the long and valiant battles
to prevent the Emperor Napoleon from conquering all of Europe. Bold eras often
have bold fashions, and none more so than the gentleman's long dress coat,
which grew out of military fashion. From the stand-up collar with pointed back
seaming and turned back lapels to the twin back pleats, diagonal once piece
cuff detail and longer length you will not find another more uniquely
flattering coat. And its useful too – with three exterior and two interior
pockets (including one than buttons closed to secure you valuables and our signature, interior
‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a money clip or cell phone).
A
dashing and elegant choice for the discerning gentleman equally at home worn
with fedora and tie, waistcoat and dress pants or jeans a comfortable weekend
shirt. Men’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.Shipping within the US $18, International Shipping $55See Size Chart and Color Information

Macheath
A rainy day in Old
London; that fog-shrouded time when night and dawn walk hand-in-hand. A tall
hat appears in the mist, accompanied by the crisp click of a brass-capped
walking stick striking against the cobbles. You squint through wet lashes to
see the face of that fine figure in the long, greatcoat. It's no avail, but as
he draws closer you hear a rich baritone sing….(to the tune of Mack the Knife)
♪♪ Oh, the shark, babe, has such teeth, dearAnd it shows them pearly white,
Just a jackknife has old Macheath, dear
And he keeps it, out of sight... ♪♪
Your heart quickens in
your throat. Macheath? The gentleman
thief of London? The cane clicks, the voice grows louder, he's nearly upon you
and there's no time to run. Lord or highwayman, gentleman or rogue, one thing
is for certain -- that is a mighty fine coat he wears.
Named for the dashing, swashbuckling
highwayman of The Three Penny Opera,
our greatcoat evokes an era when gentlemen set off for business and pleasure looking their best. Armed
with a top hat, gloves and a well-knotted, silk scarf, a proper top coat did
more than protect their finery from the rain - it was finery itself.
Macheath Greatcoat
As it was then, so it can
be now!  The Macheath Greatcoat combines
all of the classic elements of Victorian, manly elegance with touches of modern
flare. Made with plenty of pockets to stow your conveniences in (two large
outside pockets in the side seams and three interior pocket, including our
signature  ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the
right size for a jackkni…er…business cards or cell phone and two large pockets
that button closed). Our Greatcoat has a full caplet to help ward off the worst
of the weather that is sewn in to the front seams to keep it from flapping back
in your face. The front button tab detail covers a hidden zipper for easy
on/off and has the added advantage of buttoning the collar snugly around your
neck. We included generous turned back cuffs, for that extra bit of flare and
two sets of pleats in the back that provide fullness that flares dramatically
with the breeze.
A stylish and practical choice for the discerning
roustabout in you. Men’s sizes S – XXL, but there nothing to say it wouldn't
look smashing on the saucy highway women. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.Shipping within the US $23, International Shipping $55See Size Chart and Color Information
Rebecca
Last night I dreamt I
went to Manderley again... 

I came upon it
suddenly; the approach masked by the unnatural growth of a vast shrub that
spread in all directions... 

There was Manderley,
our Manderley, secretive and silent as it had always been, the gray stone
shining in the moonlight of my dream, the mullioned windows reflecting the
green lawns and terrace. Time could not wreck the perfect symmetry of those
walls, nor the site itself, a jewel in the hollow of a hand.
Since 1938, the opening lines of Daphne DuMaurier's Rebecca has taken readers by the hand
into one of the great, gothic romances of all time. But for incurable
romantics, Rebecca shall forever be the beautiful Joan Fontaine in Hitchock's
1940 masterpiece. What better name then for a waistcoat that brings back the dramatic
elegance of 1940's fashion? 

Rebecca Waistcoat
As the ultimate layering piece, our
Rebecca can sass-up any style: from office wear to a night on the town. You
will; find it equally at place with blouse and dress pants, over your favorite
snug ‘kitten’ dress, or with a favorite hat, jeans and boots for a weekend
adventuring outfit. The low cut shawl collar and ‘nipped in,’ double-breasted
waist closure do nothing but flatter your curves. The fully tailored lines
include princess seams front and back for smooth fit all finished off by a belt
in back for final fit adjustments. We’ve heard the outcry ‘women need pockets,
too!’ and so we’ve included 3 pockets – 2 welt pocket
on the outside a nice place for dainty pocket watch) and our signature interior
‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for a credit card or cell phone.
Our Rebecca may not unite
you with your heart’s desire, but you will never
be mistaken for someone else. Women’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town,
USA. Shipping within the US $12, International Shipping $35See Size Chart and Color Information
Jillian
What can you say about
Jillian? Our friends at the Urban Dictionary knew best:
Jillian is an incredible friend, who's loyal and won't stab
you in the back. She has an amazing sense of humor and loves to laugh and have
a good time. She may come up with some ideas that simple minded humans cannot
see the point or concept, these ideas takes someone else who's name shares the
same magnitude as hers. Hot/sexy would also be another good term to address her
appearance. Her intelligence is far beyond anything a simple mind can
understand so don't even try to venture down that road. Simply put Jillian is
awesome for lack of a better word.
Loyal...sexy....intelligent...awesome.
Yes, that is exactly how you'll feel when you slip our Jillian on. And just
like the Urban Dictionary, we promise that she won't let you down!
Jillian Laced Tunic/ Waistcoat
Designed to flatter
your most feminine curves and a touch of the east in her front closure frogs –
she performs the miracle of a tailored look and a ‘custom’ fit that is
instantly alterable with her back lacing. Jillian is a lady with as many
personalities as places in your wardrobe - as a sleeveless jacket for a more
polished look, a vest layered over a flouncy dress for that added touch of
flare or a tunic to wear with jeans and your favorite weekend boots.  She’s practical, too because as always we’ve
included our
signature interior ‘smugglers pocket’ – just the right size for your cell phone
or to save that napkin with the impromptu number on it. 
Our Jillian will
serve you well in all your endeavors – especially the ones that make you want
to stand out a crowd. Women’s sizes S – XXL. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA. Shipping within the US $15, International Shipping $45See Size Chart and Color Information
Marguerite
Paris, 1792 - The Terror
sweeps the city with its bloody broom.
As those high and low who
challenge the new regime are marched to the guillotine, only the mysterious
Scarlet Pimpernel stands against the madness. His allies come from all walks of
life, but none more alluring than Marguerite St. Just, a beautiful French
actress, who, entranced by the Pimpernel's exploits, forces herself into his
circle. 
Marguerite's misfortune was
to be the wife of the wealthy English fop Sir Percy Blakeney,
a baronet whose only real accomplishment is his ability to be forever
impressed with his own wit. Contemptuous of her cowardly and unloving
husband, she's acted in the Pimpernel's interests alone, only to find
herself blackmailed: reveal the identity of the Pimpernel or see her brother
die.  With nowhere else to turn, she confides in the useless Sir Percy and
learns a stunning truth -- he is the
Scarlet Pimpernel!
How will Sir Percy and
Marguerite escape the villainous Chauvelin's clutches? How can a bit of pepper
in a gift snuff box prove an evil man's undoing? You will feel ready to live
that adventure yourself when you slip into Marguerite, a frockcoat that brings
the elegance of 1800 Paris into the Twenty-first Century world. 
Marguerite
Frockcoat
From her unique pointed
lapel, to her lavishly full cascading skirts, Marguerite is a show stopper. A
touch of a men’s frockcoat at the back waist with her twin buttons and princess
seam pleats which someone how makes you look at that more feminine (what is
about women in men’s styles that is so flattering?). Her crisp, tailored
shoulders that widen into flared cuffs that are slit to show off the cuff of
your blouse. Ever the pragmatic figure she also has three pockets, two generous
side pockets in the skirts and our
interior signature ‘smugglers’ pocket just the right size for a delicate, laced
edged hanky or cell phone. 
Murder.
Blackmail. Intrigue. A ravishing beauty. All of this and true love saved by
pepper? Our lady's frockcoat will bring you all the dramatic flare, without the
risk of losing your head! (We can't say the same for that someone special who
sees you wrapped in our Marguerite's embrace!) Women’s sizes S – XXL. (Consider how you might
want to layer this piece when you choosing a size – she looks rather stunning
when layered with a waistcoat like our Rebecca.) Proudly
made in Chi-Town, USA. Shipping within the US $18, International Shipping $45See Size Chart and Color InformationBrontë'twere mad foolishness to have come here, he scolded himself. It could never be. His governess? A woman whose family had squandered all station, whose girls had lost all prospects? That was not why he had had them fetch her to Thornfield Hall! Well, if she came, he would tell her, "I am sorry, my dear Jane, but a madness overcame me." Yes, that was for the best...But those words were never to reach his lips for the thought died the moment he spied her. A shy, but proud woman, she walked with nervous determination, the long skirts of her coat swaying from side to sided as she picked her way doggedly across the green. He could see her stop to scan the countryside -- seeking, seeking him.Even from there, their eyes met and he was lost. His feet had a mind of his own as he tore across the heather, "oh my darling, darling girl...."Charlotte. Emily. Anne. The Brontë sisters were not romance writers; they wrote the novels that defined for generations what high romance was all about! Elegance and passion, but always with proper manners and just the right touch of reserve; that's what defined these amazing women and their writing, and we've tried to give them a namesake that matches.  Bright, determined women overcoming incredible odds to find happiness with their one, true love – a coat just like this. The Brontë coatdress is one of most contemporary, yet evocative garments that, just like one Charlotte's heroines, can face all manner of challenges.Brontë CoatdressIs it is a coat, is it a dress? The answer is yes. With all the fit detail of the best tailored garments and the flattering lines from gowns of years past – this style is flexible and useful in the best sense – layered with a blouse and waistcoat, over your favorite cocktail dress or worn alone, buttoned up. We’ve included lots of delightful details – generous front pockets (set flatteringly on the diagonal) as well as a dainty watch pocket, handy for loose change or perfect for accessorizing with a pocket watch. The Bronte’s full sleeves have the added function of making you waist look that much smaller as do the flared skirts. The fully lined interior includes a large stoables pocket as well as our signature ‘smugglers’ pocket just the right size for cell phone or business cards. Finished with topstitching on collar and turned back cuffs for crispness and a nice kick-slit in the back for ease of walking.  If your one true love’s heart doesn’t skip a beat when they see you in this….well, it will.Women’s sizes S – XXL, consider how you might want to layer this piece when you choosing a size. Proudly made in Chi-Town, USA.Shipping within the US $23, International Shipping $55See Size Chart and Color InformationPerks Descriptions:$10

Black Beret, Neckerchief, Tie Bar, Gatsby Cap, Paisley Tie, Pashmina Scarf or:- Black or white silk satin self-tie bowtie -or-- Heather grey fedora                    $50,000 and above: You get the ‘H’ handkerchief PLUS the Satin Scarf/Ascot AND your choice of any 3 of the following - Black Beret, Neckerchief, Tie Bar, Gatsby Cap, Paisley Tie, Pashmina Scarf, Fedora, Silk Bow Tie or:- Black and white silk paisley self-tie bowtie -or-- White or Black silk satin tie                $60,000 and above: You get the ‘H’ handkerchief PLUS the Satin Scarf/Ascot AND your choice of any 3 of the following - Black Beret, Neckerchief, Tie Bar, Gatsby Cap, Paisley Tie, Pashmina Scarf, Fedora, Silk Bow Tie, Paisley Bow Tie, Satin Tie or:-  Black or white silk paisley twill ascot                 FAQ:
I'm
having trouble with Paypal or am not sure that my payment went through. What can I do to complete my contribution?
We are sorry to hear about the difficulty!  If
you're having any trouble at all contributing via Paypal, or if you want to
confirm that your payment went through, please contact us at csr@historicaclothiers.com
and we'll do everything we can to help and make it as simple as possible for
you!
What
colors will these be available in? To begin with, we are
offer these pieces in either black or burgundy wool. Depending on demand we may
be able to offer additional color choices.
What
sizes will these be available in? We are making both Men’s
and Ladies styles in sizes S – XXL. See size chart for details:
Women's sizes
XS:  chest 34", waist 26 1/2", hip 36 1/2"
S: chest 36", waist 28 1/2", hip 38 1/2"
M: chest 38 1/2", waist 31", hip 41"
L:  chest 41 1/2", waist 34", hip 44"
XL:  chest 45 1/2", waist 38", hip 48"
XXL: chest 49 1/2", waist 43", hip 52"
Men's sizes
S: neck 14 1/2", chest 36", waist 30", sleeve 34"
M: neck 15 1/2", chest 40", waist 34", sleeve 34 1/2"  
L:  neck 16 1/2", chest 44", waist 38", sleeve 34 1/2"
XL: neck 17 1/2", chest 48", waist 42", sleeve 36 1/2"
XXL: neck 18 1/2", chest 52", waist 46", sleeve 37 ½"
How
do I pick my size, color, stretch goal perk, etc?
No worries! Here is how Indiegogo works: we receive
your contact information when you contribute, and after the campaign, we'll
reach out to have you confirm all the details of your order.  
Can
I change my order?
We are making each of these limited edition garments
just for you. As our introductory line these are virtually one-of-kinds made for you - we won't know until the campaign ends which styles will become part of our permanent line. What we are offering here won't necessarily be representative of what will be our regular stock
on our website so we won’t have extra stock to be able to switch your choice or
accept exchanges. So choose carefully. 
Can
I order custom sizes or colors?
In a word, no. In order to be able to offer you
great, original clothes at these prices we need to use economies of scale in
production which means there needs to be some uniformity and limits to colors
and sizes. But these are well made, tailored garments with real seam allowance
so if you need a few tweaks like the waist taken in, a hem lengthened, etc –
they are made to be alterable just like men’s suits and can be custom fit you
by your local alterations shop – which is only way to get that ‘made for you’
fit.
When
will I receive what I bought?
The second the campaign ends, January 31st,
we start collating the results and finding out exactly what you’d like us to
make. We then go into production the second week in February with the aim to
ship them out to you by the end of March.
Can
you explain about the cost of the garments?
We're facing several challenges which contribute to
the bottom line of our styles: we produce locally, just outside of Chicago, USA
(which is necessary to properly oversee all the details of production and make
sure it gets made well but is costly), we're not producing in huge numbers like
the big brands out there (which means higher cost per garment); and everyone
involved in our process makes a living wage, is treated well and works in good
working conditions (we are committed to working with partners that treat their
workers fairly).
In the end, the Historica Clothiers that has all the
features that the major labels do (actually allot more detail than most mass
produced clothing), and, despite the challenges our products are competitively
priced with equivalent pieces – that is the few out there that are actually
producing well-made, well-cut, full featured clothing. That is, made of 100%
wool with details like real pockets, full lining, under-stitched hems and sleeve
caps – all things that add to the look, functionality and life of each garment.
Why
is International Shipping so expensive?
The simple answer is these are our shipping costs –
we aren’t making any money on in it. The last few years shipping costs have
risen dramatically. We’re sorry. We love having customers all over the world.

Credits and Thanks:This couldn't have happened without the help, inspiration and hard work of Kathy Henry, Rebecca Smith-Cruz, Jonathan Cruz, Heather Hilchey, Treyson Ptak, Greg Mele and Jill Allen who acted in turns as techo-whizs, models, writers, consultants and all-around cheerleaders.

story:
If you like our video, click above and share it with your friends ;)


Thank you for checking us out! 

The UHDLT seed was planted a year and a half ago and has been growing rapidly thanks to the overwhelming support of so many people. While volunteer tutoring at a homeless shelter through an organization called School on Wheels my eyes were opened to the growing digital divide in our society. Students with incredible drive to persevere through adversity lacked the resources and knowledge needed to succeed in the computer-dependant world in which we now live. I wanted to help bridge this gap through blended learning programs that would not only teach these students the basic essential computer skills, but also open their minds to the wealth of knowledge and opportunities available to them through skillful navigation of the Internet. 

I was inspired by the innovative concept of creating shared value to help fund this mission. 

Christina joined my vision and we decided to create tablet and laptop cases that are so utterly awesome that the success of the UHDLT products would generate funding for the cause we are passionate about. After a year of working with industry veterans, the UHDLT collection has been perfected and is ready for launch! We are so excited to see where this idea will lead. 

xoxo, Jen and Christina


Check out the GALLERY tab above for more photos of your favorite case!



UHDLT cases are made locally in California by a woman-owned manufacturing company (how rad is that?!). And we are launching EXCLUSIVELY on Indiegogo, so this is your opportunity to not only receive one of these bad boys, but to play a key role in making this idea a reality. 

•  For a donation of $35 you will receive a tablet case in the style of your choice. 

•  For a donation of $42 you will receive a 13" or 15" laptop case in the style of your choice. 

Check out the REWARDS column to your right for more details! Shipping within the United States is $5 and has already been added to each reward box. For Canada please include an additional $5; all other countries worldwide please add $10. 


KNOWLEDGE IS POWER. We donate 25% of our profits to School on Wheels to help fund their new Blended Learning program. And as our company grows we CANNOT WAIT to watch School on Wheels and their innovative programs grow with us! 

School on Wheels on their Blended Learning program:

For more details about this awesome new program check out the link below!

http://www.schoolonwheels.org/blog

Your purchase is not just giving a thing, it's planting a dream.


UHDLT is our modification of the world ADULT (yes, pronounced exactly the same). We believe in creating opportunities by breaking through gates traditionally locked by conventional “wisdom.” We all have the ability to blaze our own trails and sometimes the most untraditional experiences grant the greatest rewards. We make UHDLT cases for the unconventional adult. 

We at UHDLT are firm believers in the incredible power of encouragement and this project would not be where it is today without five special words. SAY YES TO THE UNIVERSE are the borrowed words of wisdom from a dear friend that got the UHDLT wheels turning. They are a reminder to not dwell on the negative, but rather think of all the positive possibilities that could stem from SAYING YES when the UNIVERSE presents you with an opportunity. Inspiration is infectious, which is why we want to share these special words with all of you. Stitched to the inside of every UHDLT case you will find your SAY YES TO THE UNIVERSE label as a daily reminder to live your life to the fullest, dream the grandest, and always...

Thank you to everyone who has helped get UHDLT to where it is today!

Models: The drop-dead gorgeous Kayla Maciel, Prysilla Martiz, Ana Anvari, Summer Hume, and many make-you-aww-they're-so-adorable kids

Photographer/Videographer: everyone's favorite hipster and newly proud papa, Mr. Dan Turner 

Video Editors: Scott and Tony from Gro Productions (our editors are cooler than yours)

Inspiration provider/SayYesToTheUniverse Creator/Copy Editor: Scelena Richardson

Idea Sparker: My brillant, tough little cookie student who shall remain anonymous. You know who you are :) 

Our amazing/spectacular/bouncing ray of sunshine intern: Katie Philipson 

And a very special THANK YOU and shout out to Joe Herrera...our jack-of-all-trades - graphic designer, videographer, photographer, Nick's burrito provider, model, and most importantly, #1 supporter. This guy has spent countless hours putting UHDLT even before himself. Thank. You. So. Much.    

Q. I’m an Indiegogo novice. How does this work?

A. So, basically, we post our project on Indiegogo’s site, set a funding goal and tell you all about it. If you’re into it, you donate/pre-order our product. After 45 days, when the campaign ends, we get to work! As soon as we hit our funding goal, we will complete our first production run and be on our way to becoming a successful socially conscious business working toward education equality! Don’t worry, even if we don’t hit our goal, we will be making enough cases to fulfill our contributor’s orders. But let’s be honest… these cases and our cause are amazing and we are determined to make this dream a reality!

Q. How do I follow UHDLT’s progress?

A. When you contribute to our campaign, you become part of our project! We will keep you updated on our progress through our mailing list and you can email us directly with any questions or comments. You can also follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter @uhdlt. A little inside scoop for ya…we’ll be hosting Facebook contests to win a few free cases, so be sure to like our page at https://www.facebook.com/UHDLT.

Q. Can I just donate?

A. Sure! Don’t have a laptop or tablet, but you believe in our mission and want to help us reach our goal? Hit the "Contribute Now" button on our page and donate however much you’d like. We really appreciate your support!

Q. Can I buy an UHDLT case as a gift?

A. Of course! If you want us to ship a case as a gift just make sure you include the giftee’s information as the shipping address. Also, we know the holidays are quickly approaching and you may want to give an UHDLT case as a holiday gift, but they might not be ready in time. Not to fear. Let us know if your pre-order is a gift and we will email you a little something-something that you can either print out and wrap or send via email. 

Q. Alright, my case is pre-ordered. Now what are some other ways I can help? 

A. We're so glad you asked! We would love for you to make some noise about our project to your friends. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share, tweet, post, and blog your little hearts out. It could even be a great conversation starter for that cute boy or girl in class or at work you’ve been meaning to talk to. Yep, you’re welcome. But seriously, you spreading the word about our cases and our cause would mean the world to us!

Q. How long will it take to receive my case? I want it now!

A. Whoa, Veruca Salt. We are going to do our darndest to get these cases to you as soon as possible, but we are a small company just starting out, so your patience is GREATLY appreciated. Just so you have an idea, this is what our production timeline looks like…

It will take roughly 3 weeks once production begins to complete and ship 250 cases, so if you are within the first 1,000 contributors to order you can expect to receive your case sometime between February and March. 

We will do everything in our power to expedite this process. 

Q. And shipping?

Note that we included the $5 domestic shipping cost in the REWARD price to make it easier.

Domestic shipping – $5 if shipping anywhere within the United States.

If shipping internationally – $10 to Canada, $15 Worldwide.

*So please ADD $5 for Canada and please ADD $10 Worldwide.

Q. What if I just can’t decide which one I want?

A. Perfectly normal. We understand your dilemma. Lucky for you there is no limit to how many cases you can order and with six unique designs you can show off a different one almost every day of the week!

Q. Are you going to make more prints?

A. That’s the idea! We want to keep our cases fresh and unique, so when our current stock of prints run out, we will be launching a whole new line. Let me re-iterate that. When we run out of a print, we’re out. You might want to go order your favorite NOW before it’s too late.

Q. How should I care for my case?

A. UHDLT cases can be easily spot-cleaned with soap and a moist towel.

Q. How do I choose my size and style?

A. The REWARDS section is divided by each style and size. So if you really want The Havana and you own a 13” laptop, look for the reward box titled The Havana 13” Case. It’s that simple.

Q. How do I know my case will fit my tablet/laptop?

A. This is pretty important. Our cases were designed to fit iPads, 13” MacBook Pros and 15” MacBook Pros comfortably. If you own any of those products, you’re good to go. But even if you aren’t an Apple-ite, we may still have something for you. Just check the dimensions below and please make sure your device will fit WELL WITHIN the dimensions of our cases. 

Q. Change of heart?

A. If you happen to order the wrong size or you accidentally click the wrong style, we will exchange your case for another size or style. Just email us, info@uhdlt.com.

Q. Still have an unanswered question?

A. Shoot us an email, info@uhdlt.com. We will get back to you as soon as possible.
story_txt:
If you like our video, click above and share it with your friends ;)


Thank you for checking us out! The UHDLT seed was planted a year and a half ago and has been growing rapidly thanks to the overwhelming support of so many people. While volunteer tutoring at a homeless shelter through an organization called School on Wheels my eyes were opened to the growing digital divide in our society. Students with incredible drive to persevere through adversity lacked the resources and knowledge needed to succeed in the computer-dependant world in which we now live. I wanted to help bridge this gap through blended learning programs that would not only teach these students the basic essential computer skills, but also open their minds to the wealth of knowledge and opportunities available to them through skillful navigation of the Internet. 
I was inspired by the innovative concept of creating shared value to help fund this mission. 




Christina joined my vision and we decided to create tablet and laptop cases that are so utterly awesome that the success of the UHDLT products would generate funding for the cause we are passionate about. After a year of working with industry veterans, the UHDLT collection has been perfected and is ready for launch! We are so excited to see where this idea will lead. 



xoxo, Jen and Christina








Check out the GALLERY tab above for more photos of your favorite case!
















UHDLT cases are made locally in California by a woman-owned manufacturing company (how rad is that?!). And we are launching EXCLUSIVELY on Indiegogo, so this is your opportunity to not only receive one of these bad boys, but to play a key role in making this idea a reality. 


• 
For a donation
of $35 you will receive a tablet case in the style of your choice. 
• 
For a donation
of $42 you will receive a 13" or 15" laptop case in the style of your
choice. 
Check out the
REWARDS column to your right for more details! Shipping within the United States is $5 and has already been added to each reward box. For Canada please include an additional $5; all other countries worldwide please add $10. 






KNOWLEDGE IS POWER. We donate 25% of our profits to School
on Wheels to help fund their new Blended Learning program. And as our
company grows we CANNOT WAIT to watch School
on Wheels and their innovative programs grow with us! 
School on Wheels on their Blended Learning program:


For more details about this awesome new program check out the link below!
http://www.schoolonwheels.org/blog

Your purchase is not just giving a thing, it's planting a dream.













UHDLT is our modification of the world ADULT (yes, pronounced
exactly the same). We believe in creating opportunities by breaking through
gates traditionally locked by conventional “wisdom.” We all have the ability to
blaze our own trails and sometimes the most untraditional experiences grant the
greatest rewards. We make UHDLT cases for the unconventional adult. 












We at UHDLT are firm believers in the
incredible power of encouragement and this project would not be where it is
today without five special words. SAY YES TO THE UNIVERSE are the borrowed words of wisdom from a dear friend that got the UHDLT wheels turning. They are a reminder to not dwell on the negative, but rather think of all the positive possibilities that could stem from SAYING YES when the UNIVERSE presents you with an opportunity. Inspiration is infectious, which is why we want to share these special words with all of you. Stitched to the inside of every UHDLT case you will find your SAY YES TO THE UNIVERSE label as a daily reminder to live your life to the fullest, dream the grandest, and always...




Thank you to everyone who has helped get UHDLT to where it is today!
Models: The drop-dead gorgeous Kayla Maciel, Prysilla Martiz, Ana Anvari, Summer Hume, and many make-you-aww-they're-so-adorable kids
Photographer/Videographer: everyone's favorite hipster and newly proud papa, Mr. Dan Turner 
Video Editors: Scott and Tony from Gro Productions (our editors are cooler than yours)
Inspiration provider/SayYesToTheUniverse Creator/Copy Editor: Scelena Richardson
Idea Sparker: My brillant, tough little cookie student who shall remain anonymous. You know who you are :) 
Our amazing/spectacular/bouncing ray of sunshine intern: Katie Philipson 
And a very special THANK YOU and shout out to Joe Herrera...our jack-of-all-trades - graphic designer, videographer, photographer, Nick's burrito provider, model, and most importantly, #1 supporter. This guy has spent countless hours putting UHDLT even before himself. Thank. You. So. Much.

A. So, basically, we post our project on Indiegogo’s site, set a funding
goal and tell you all about it. If you’re into it, you donate/pre-order our
product. After 45 days, when the campaign ends, we get to work! As soon as we
hit our funding goal, we will complete our first production run and be on our
way to becoming a successful socially conscious business working toward
